intro: Serratula orientalis, commonly known as oriental sowthistle, is an annual flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a cluster of small flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy, lobed leaves and yellow flowers that bloom from late spring to early autumn. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine, though the plant contains toxic compounds that can be harmful if ingested. Serratula orientalis is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including fields and roadsides.
